acceptance_criteria: - Command templates a bean entry at src/content/beans/<YYYY-MM-DD>-<beanKey>.md with frontmatter aligned to the beans schema and body placeholder.

title: Create bean entry for 2026-02-01 Mocha Java Switch brew

notes: Entry created at src/content/beans/2026-02-01-bean1.md with image /images/2026-02-01-sun-brew-from-above.png.

title: Use Dependabot at CI level to keep dependencies updated
description: Add Dependabot automation for GitHub Actions and npm dependencies so updates are proposed continuously and validated in CI before merge.
acceptance_criteria:
- Dependabot config exists under .github/dependabot.yml and checks npm + GitHub Actions on a recurring schedule
- CI runs for Dependabot PRs with the same required checks as other PRs
- Auto-generated PRs include sensible grouping/rate limits to avoid noisy update spam
- Docs briefly explain how Dependabot is configured and how to tune cadence

title: Make blockquote styling more distinct while preserving contrast
description: Update the blockquote styling to feel more distinct (consider italics), while preserving contrast ratios for readability and accessibility.
notes: Learned: Blockquote styles only apply when markdown content carries the .markdown class; the bean log needed .bean-content.markdown. Also needed real italic font variants (Source Serif 4) to make quotes visibly distinct.

title: Enable reliable UI previews for bean posts in Codex
description: Devise a way to capture UI previews of posts from the running dev server (e.g., tmux pane with npm run dev on port 4321, /beans/log/<slug>/). Explore options like Playwright MCP or other skills/integrations to let Codex generate and share previews when requested.
notes:
Example desired preview: /beans/log/2026-02-05-bean1/ on port 4321.
Duplicate of beans-2xo.

title: Make inline code/backtick styling more distinct
description: Adjust inline code/backtick styling to be more visually distinct while preserving contrast ratios. Relate this work to the blockquote styling task so both are reviewed together.

title: Install and configure Playwright skill for Codex previews
description: Add setup steps for installing Playwright and configuring it as a Codex skill or MCP integration to enable UI previews and screenshots from the running dev server. Provide a container-local vision loop (Codex ‚Üí MCP ‚Üí headless browser ‚Üí screenshot ‚Üí model). Ensure Chromium install, and document/automate devcontainer startup (e.g., postCreateCommand/postStartCommand). Include guidance for using container-local http://localhost and fullPage screenshots.
notes: Learned: Codex needs a container-local browser (Playwright MCP) and a stable MCP URL (http://localhost:5173/mcp) with npx -y to avoid prompts. Also, @playwright/mcp uses --viewport-size, not --viewport.

title: Honor optional bean attributes in rendering; avoid undefined time
description: Align bean entry rendering with project spirit: treat all attributes as optional and do not display placeholders or labels for missing values. Specifically ensure bean log headers do not show `undefined` when `time` is absent.
acceptance_criteria:
- Rendering logic only shows attributes when values are present (no empty/undefined placeholders)
- Behavior is documented as intentional project convention: attributes are optional and omitted when missing
- Bean log header does not render `undefined` when `time` is missing (e.g., `BEAN 2026-02-06` without trailing ` / undefined`)
- Regression check includes an entry without `time`
notes: Implemented optional attribute rendering, fixed missing-time header, added regression check, merged to main and pushed.

title: Enable AI screenshot inspection via Playwright MCP
description: Provide a container-local vision loop so AI agents can capture screenshots for UI verification (Codex ‚Üí MCP ‚Üí headless browser ‚Üí screenshot ‚Üí model). Set up Playwright MCP server, ensure Chromium install, and document/automate devcontainer startup. Include guidance for using container-local http://localhost and screenshots/fullPage.

title: Add markdown accessibility linting for content entries
description: Introduce a content lint step that checks markdown accessibility requirements across all entries (beans, equipment, roasters, recipes). Validate that every markdown image has non-empty alt text and that heading levels follow the expected hierarchy (H2 section headers, H3 subsection headers, no skipped levels).
acceptance_criteria: - CI runs the a11y lint on PRs and fails on violations\n- Image syntax requires non-empty alt text (e.g., ![Alt](/beans/images/...) )\n- Heading structure enforces H2 then H3 (no H1/H4 skips) and flags out-of-order headings

title: fix failed ci deploy to github pages starting with commit 1d2643d
notes:
Root cause: rss.xml.ts imported sanitize-html (missing dependency). Reworked RSS rendering to use @astrojs/markdown-remark + escapeHtml to avoid extra deps; build passes locally.
Closed: RSS no longer depends on sanitize-html; build passes locally.

title: Add CI content integrity checks for bean entry backlinks
description: Add a pull-request CI check that validates bean content referential integrity across collections. The check should parse the Astro content collections and ensure any slugs referenced from bean frontmatter (roaster, roast, brewer, recipe, grinder, gear) resolve to existing entries.
acceptance_criteria: - CI runs on PRs and fails if referential integrity is broken\n- Validation covers beans, equipment, roasters, recipes, and other linked collections\n- Each content entity includes a Markdown 'References' section with named links for backlinks, and the checker enforces presence + link target validity

title: Auto-start/attach tmux in Codespaces terminals
description: In GitHub Codespaces, tmux server dies when the container stops. Add an auto-start/auto-attach hook so new terminals attach to the last tmux session (or create one) during interactive shells, without nesting inside tmux.
acceptance_criteria: - Opening a new Codespaces terminal attaches to existing tmux session if present\n- If no session exists, a new session is created automatically\n- No nested tmux when already inside a session
notes: Added Codespaces auto-attach snippet to ~/.bashrc and ~/.zshrc in .devcontainer/setup-tmux.sh; updated docs/dev/tmux.md with behavior.

title: install neovim devcontainer feature
description: ensure that the terminal editor is set to neovim with a sensible default configuration with syntax highlighting set up for this project.

title: Configure Codex to skip permissions by default in Codespaces
description: Configure Codex defaults so that when running inside GitHub Codespaces, permission prompts are skipped automatically (use Codespaces environment variables to detect the environment). This should be repo-local and not affect non-Codespaces runs.
acceptance_criteria:
- Codex uses skip-permissions by default when Codespaces env vars are present
- Detection relies on GitHub Codespaces environment variables (not a hardcoded path)
- Non-Codespaces runs keep existing permission behavior
- Document the setting location and env var check
notes: Implemented repo-local Codespaces Codex defaults: added .codex codespaces profile, devcontainer setup-codex shell wrapper keyed on CODESPACES/CODESPACE_NAME, and docs/dev/codex.md.
